metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for page management interface

steps.action: Navigated to Pages panel in PersonaBar (Admin > Content > Pages)
steps.expected: Pages panel should load with all localized UI strings displayed correctly
steps.actual: Pages panel loaded successfully with all UI elements displayed correctly including: 'Pages' heading, 'Add Page', 'Add Multiple Pages', 'Save Page Template' buttons, 'Details'/'Permissions'/'Advanced' tabs, and all field labels (Name, Title, Description, Keywords, Tags, Parent Page, Workflow, Link Tracking, etc.)

steps.action: Verified resource strings from EvoqPages.resx are properly loaded
steps.expected: Strings like 'Save Page Template', 'Workflow', 'Link Tracking' should be displayed from the resource file
steps.actual: All resource strings from EvoqPages.resx are correctly displayed in the UI including SaveAsTemplate.Text ('Save Page Template'), WorkflowTitle.Text ('Workflow'), LinkTrackingTitle.Text ('Link Tracking'), and Template.Text labels

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test language switching and fallback behavior

steps.action: Switched from English (en-US) to Spanish (es-AR) locale by navigating to http://localhost:8081/es-ar/
steps.expected: The system should accept the language switch and handle localization appropriately
steps.actual: Successfully switched to Spanish locale. URL changed to /es-ar/. The localization framework correctly handled the switch.

steps.action: Opened Pages panel in Spanish locale
steps.expected: UI should display in Spanish if translations exist, or fall back to English
steps.actual: Pages panel opened successfully. UI strings displayed in English (fallback) since Spanish translation files don't exist. Importantly, the date format changed from MM/DD/YYYY (12/27/2025) to DD/MM/YYYY (27/12/2025), demonstrating locale-aware date formatting is working correctly.

observations: Only the base English resource file (EvoqPages.resx) exists in the codebase at admin/personaBar/App_LocalResources/
No language-specific resource files (e.g., EvoqPages.es-AR.resx, EvoqPages.fr-FR.resx) were found, so the UI falls back to English for all non-English locales
The localization framework correctly implements fallback behavior - when a locale-specific translation is not available, it uses the default English strings
Date formatting is locale-aware: dates display as MM/DD/YYYY in English locale and DD/MM/YYYY in Spanish locale
The site supports 5 languages via the language selector: English (United States), Spanish (Argentina), French (France), German (Germany), and Arabic (Eritrea)
